dmca.title: Vintage Lighting Fixtures Stiffing Website Designers?
dmca.body:
November 12, 2002
    
    Google, Inc.
    Attn. User Support, DMCA complaints
    [private]
    Mountain View, CA 94043
    re: Vintagelightingfixtures.com
    
    In answer to your required information:
    
    1. The work in question is the entire website www.vintagelightingfixtures.com. The website was
    originally designed by my company, SG Design Group and is presently being used by Vintage
    Lighting Fixtures without our consent or authorization and without payment in full for past
    graphic and website services rendered.
    
    2. The entire website www.vintagelightingfixtures.com.
    
    3. I can be reached at SG Design Group [private] Spring Valley, NY 10977.
    [private]
    [private]
    
    4. Vintage Lighting Fixtures and owners, [private] , can be reached at [private] Parksville, NY. By phone at [private] or [private][private].com. Or, [private] Liberty, NY 12754 which is their
    advertised business location.
    
    5. I have a good faith belief that use of the computer materials described above, namely the
    website
    vintagelightingfixtures.com, is not authorized by my company who originally designed the
    website, or by the law.
    
    You should be aware that the Rockland County, NY DA's Office is currently investigating the
    Owners of
    Vintagelightingfixtures.com for accepting payment and not delivering. The Rockland Journal
    News and ABC Online have covered the story which tells of the owners [private],
    disappearing from their store in Nyack, NY leaving behind many upset customers who paid in
    full for their merchandise.
    http://www.thejournalnews.com/newsroom/082202/22nolights.html
    http://abclocal.go.com/wabc/news/WABC-082302-lightingstore.html
    I am left with a bill for almost $25,000 USD for graphic and web services rendered. They have    
    absolutely no right to use my company's work without paying for it.
    
    Further, I have recently filed charges of Theft of Services, and Criminal Possession of
    Computer Material and Unlawful Duplication of Computer Data, respectively under NY State
    Penal Law, PL 165.15 (11) PL 156.35 and PL 156.30 (11); two of which I believe are felonies
    in the State of NY.
    
    6. I swear, under penalty of perjury, that the information in the notification is accurate and
    that I am the copyright owner or am authorized to act on behalf of the owner of an exclusive
    right that is allegedly infringed.
    
    Thank you for your immediate attention to this important matter,
    
    [Private]
    SG Design Group
    [private]
    [private]
               
    
    -------------------        -----------    -----------         ---
    
    The following is a confirmation from Overture that they have removed Vintage Lighting
    Fixtures form their advertising services after I had filed a similar complaint:
    
    Dear [Private],
    
    Pursuant to our obligation under the Copyright Act and based on your DMCA
    Notice, we removed the listing from Overture's search results.
    
    Sincerely yours,
    
    [Private]
    
    -2-
